page.title: 03THE PARISH OF ETTRICK.
page.content: The Parish of Ettrick centres round Ettrick Kirk.Records of a church in the Valley go back to the 13th century when by a charter of 1235 the lands of Ettrick from the source beyond Potburn in the West were gifted by King Alexander the II of Scotland to the monks of Melrose Abbey.The original chapel was sited further up the river at Over Kirkhope but reference to "the New Kirk of Ettrick"is made in the middle of the 15th century and this is believed to have been near the site of the present church.This was built in 1824 to replace,according to the records a dilapidated building with turf and heather roof.Built into it are 2 original stones,one a probable tombstone inscribed RSS Memento Mori- 1619,a record of an erstwhile Scott of Thirlstane.
